description: This 1965 Corvette Roadster presented in its original color code 900UU Rally Red is gorgous to say the least. The body is very nice not cracked up or broken up with very nice door gaps and panel fittment. The body is slick and straight with what looks to be original chrome and glass. This Corvette is optioned with side exhaust and spinner hub caps giving it the classic Corvette look everyone is looking for. The powerplant is a 1967 327/300 with a casting number of 3892657 (pictured) backed by a 4 speed manual transmission. The car runs drives and shift very well and is a snap to drive thanks to the optional power steering. The undercarriage is very nice with the frame being solid, spare tire carrier in place and also 4 wheel disc brakes. On the inside the black bucket seat interior is very nice with new carpeting in the drivers compartment and in the rear storage compartment also. The gauges are functional and very bright and crisp. The car has been fitted with an aftermarket AM/FM stereo also. The convertible top looks to be new also with a very clear rear window. This mid year is a nice example and a pleasure to drive! Call Scott for further details at 615 476 1195.  Tn residents will pay all applicable tax ,tag and doc fees. All out of state buyers will pay a $124.95 doc fee and a .003% tax required by my state on all out of state sales. (about 30 bucks on 10k) TNRODS

description: .This 1964 Chevrolet Corvette Sting Ray 2 Door Convertible
(Stock # B11228)
is available in our Benicia, CA showroom and any inquiries may be directed to us at
or via email at
Sales@SpecialtySales.com

New to our Benicia showroom is this gorgeous 1964 Chevrolet Corvette Sting Ray 2 Door Convertible with red exterior paint, a black soft top and a black leather interior. It features a 327 cid V-8 engine under the hood with an automatic transmission and this gorgeous sports car is loaded with power front disc brakes, premium alloy wheels, a brand new stereo system and so much more. This vehicle was restored earlier this year to a very high level and it is in like-new condition throughout.

The current owner of this 1964 Chevrolet Corvette Sting Ray Roadster tells us that the previous owner spent a small fortune on this convertible by overhauling the entire vehicle in 2014. The entire drivetrain was rebuilt throughout and many new accessories (including brake and cooling systems) were installed at that time as well. This desirable classic was also stripped to the bare fiber glass and repainted, plus it received a new interior, new wheels/tires and new chrome side pipes. A bulge hood was painted and installed as well, although the current owner will also include the original hood as part of the sale.

In terms of actual curb appeal, this This 1964 Chevrolet Corvette could easily pass for a new classic vehicle. It starts nicely with a nice growl from the engine and the performance is truly second to none. Great handling, nice acceleration, tight cornering; this one does everything well with a terrific overall feel. The body is also exceptional and the interior is all new throughout. In fact, the new soft top has never been lowered except by the installer.

Overall, this This 1964 Chevrolet Corvette Sting Ray Roadster is one of the nicest examples we’ve seen nationwide and it is an amazing buy at the current asking price. Just the parts/labor alone likely add up to more than what you can drive this beauty home for today, so do not expect for this fantastic value to remain here for long. It’s simply too nice to last. For more information about this vehicle, visit our Benicia, California showroom, give us a call at
, or email us at
Sales@SpecialtySales.com
. Be sure to mention
Stock # B11228
as well.

description: This 1970 Chevrolet Corvette 2 Door Coupe
(Stock # P10180)
is available in our Pleasanton, CA showroom and any inquiries may be directed to us at
or by email at
Sales@SpecialtySales.com

The next amazing classic to enter our Pleasanton showroom is this exceptionally rare 1970 Chevrolet Corvette 2 Door Coupe with Steel City Grey exterior paint and a black leather interior. According to the current owner, his one comes highly optioned from the factory with an original LT1, 350 CI V-8 engine matched with the matching 4-speed manual transmission, both of which have been rebuilt within the last 400 miles. This rare and beautiful sports car is in excellent shape as well and it should find a new home quickly at the current asking price.

Although there were over 17,300 C3 Corvettes produced in the 1970 model year, only 1,287 of them included the $447.60 optional high performance LT1 engine. For comparison, the LS5 big block with 390 HP was a $289.65 add-on, and since so little was known about the brand new high performance LT1, very few were actually sold at the premium price tag. So it’s very hard to tell how many are still in existence today with their factory engines still in-tact. This particular 1970 Chevrolet Corvette is a three-owner lifetime classic that’s nicely documented showing its history. The current owner claims to have documentation proving the numbers-matching drivetrain as well and we see nothing here to lead us to believe otherwise. This example is in very nice original shape as well with very nice paint, an above average factory interior and excellent performance on the open road. This one still moves like a champion.

Overall, this 1970 Chevrolet Corvette is an incredible find that will make the day of one lucky collector in the weeks to come. These first-year LT1 examples are very rare to surface these days so don’t expect for this one to last long- it’s simply priced too conservatively to stick around our showroom. For more information about this vehicle, visit our Pleasanton, California showroom, give us a call at
, or email us at
Sales@SpecialtySales.com
. Be sure to mention
Stock # P10180
as well.

description: Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1968 Chevrolet Corvette.  HISTORY  For 1968, both the Corvette body and interior were completely redesigned. As before, the car was available in either coupe or convertible models, but coupe was now a notchback fitted with a near-vertical removable rear window and removable roof panels (T-tops). A soft folding top was included with convertibles, while an auxiliary hardtop with a glass rear window was offered at additional cost. Included with coupes were hold down straps and a pair of vinyl bags to store the roof panels, and above the luggage area was a rear window stowage tray. The enduring new body's concealed headlights moved into position via a vacuum operated system rather than electrically as on the previous generation, and the new hide-away windshield wipers utilized a problematic vacuum door. The door handles were flush with the top of the doors with a separate release button. Front fenders had functional engine cooling vents. Side vent windows were eliminated from all models, replaced with "Astro Ventilation", a fresh air circulation system. In the cabin, a large round speedometer and matching tachometer were positioned in front of the driver. Auxiliary gauges were clustered above the forward end of the console and included oil pressure, water temperature, ammeter, fuel gauge, and an analog clock. A fiber-optic system appeared on the console that monitored exterior lights and there was no glove box. The battery was relocated from the engine area to one of three compartments behind the seats to improve weight distribution. New options included a rear window defroster, anti-theft alarm system, bright metal wheel covers, and an AM-FM Stereo radio. All cars ordered with a radio, like the C2 cars, continued to be fitted with chrome-plated ignition shielding covering the distributor to reduce interference. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA  SPECIFICS / BUILD INFORMATION  EXTERIOR  -Silverstone Silver paint.  -Black convertible top.  INTERIOR  -Gunmetal interior.  -Original Guages.  MECHANICAL  -427ci V8 bored .060 over, balanced, high dome pistons, mild cam.  -Muncie 4-Speed.  -Power Steering.  -Power brakes.  DISCLOSURE  -Windshield wipers missing but motor works.  -Radio is missing.  -There are a few chips / imperfections in the paint. (See detailed pictures)  For more details on any disclosure items please contact a sales agent today at 1-877-422-2940.    The cost of parts and restoration of these vehicles are increasing daily. They are not making any more and, therefore, they are becoming more rare by the day. Buy one complete and ensure your investment for the future. An excellent investment and something you can enjoy daily. Collectible vintage vehicles have historically appreciated at a rate greater than that stock market, gold and other arts and collectibles as documented by many articles and auction result tracking.     NEED MORE DETAILED INFORMATION? CALL US AND WE WILL HELP ANY WAY POSSIBLE!   1-87
